intro: Miltonia × cogniauxiae var. pallida, commonly known as the pale Miltonia, is a hybrid orchid native to the tropical regions of South America. It is characterized by its large, showy flowers with a pale pink to white coloration, often featuring a contrasting lip. The plant typically grows as an epiphyte, attaching itself to trees in its natural habitat. Its leaves are broad and革质 (leathery), providing structural support and aiding in water retention. This variety is prized for its ornamental value and is often cultivated for its beauty in both greenhouse and home environments.
